Fields.DialogueText: All hands, prepare for combat! We'll reach the target in but a few minutes.
Takao! What are you doing? We need to get ready.
Don't mind me. I am simply meditating in preparation for the coming battle.
Is now really the best time?
Yes, it is. Now, please -- I must concentrate.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry I disturbed you.
Now's not the time to rest.
Shouldn't you be focusing on the impending fight?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, that's all right. A true warrior never lets anything distract her.
This is hardly a nap. By meditating, your mind opens up to new possibilities, and you strengthen your resolve for what is to come.
I am doing exactly that. With a clear mind, you will not give into fear, arrogance, or confusion on the battlefield.
Besides, all we can do right now is wait.
You're right. It's just that the anticipation is nerve-wracking. I wish I could be as calm as you right now.
One does not climb a mountain without first traversing the foothills. Keep at it, and you will become a hero.
I appreciate your confidence in my ability, Takao. I'll let you meditate in peace, then. All right, who else can I–
Brace yourself, Kanchou!
*BOOM*
How did you...?
Come on, Kanchou. There's no time to waste. For the glory of the Emperor!
@BATTLE
Hello, Takao. What are you doing?
Kata -- exercises with my sword.
Interesting. You do this every day?
Yes. It is critical that I do not allow myself to slacken in my duties.
Even in the rain?
Especially in the rain. It builds up my endurance.

Fields.MenuText: A sword won't be too effective against the Morganas, though.
It's good to stay in shape.
You seem very graceful, yet deadly, in those routines.

Fields.DialogueText: It may not be, but nevertheless, this is a way to strengthen myself for the coming trials. And I must be prepared to draw upon all my skills to win.
Yes, though it is more than a physical exercise. It also serves the purpose of strengthening the spirit.
Indeed. Such is the way of the samurai.
Do you think you can train me?
Train you?
Yes.
Understand that this is no trivial dabbling. If you wish to train under me, you must never hesitate before the challenges.
I'll... do my best.
That is all I can ask. The first step of your training is to prove yourself in battle. Speaking of which...
@BATTLE
Your flank is exposed!
Ow! That hurt, Takao.
I warned you that the training would be arduous -- and don't allow yourself to falter! This is a battle.
All right, all right! Take that!
A lucky hit, but a hit nonetheless. Well done. But your swordplay still needs some work.
Can we take a break at least?
Fine. You need to get into better shape, though.
So my ability could use some work. It isn't as if swordplay is a part of modern day training regimens.
I know. That's why I'll help you get stronger. Any questions before we continue?

Fields.MenuText: How long will it take me to become as good as you?
Can we try other exercises as well?
Be honest. How am I shaping up?

Fields.DialogueText: You should not focus on such ends. The journey is what truly gives you strength. Have faith in yourself, and your strength will be proven.
In time. But I will not rest until you have at least passing mastery in each art of war and peace.
To be candid, terrible. But practice makes perfect.
Now, then. Back to work.
Actually, Takao...
Don't let yourself get distracted.
I could say the same to you! There's a Morgana closing in.
Oh. Well, this offers us the chance to apply our training to combat. Let us see what you have learned, pupil.
@BATTLE
Sigh. I should have known.
Let's see if anything bites...
Good day, Kanchou. What are you doing?
I'm fishing!
I see. The sea is full of life, isn't it? It still amazes me how there can be so much apart from land in the world.
Yes, it can be kind of humbling, can't it? But anyway, I'm hoping I can catch some seafood for dinner. Care to give it a shot, too?
Thank you, but I must decline. I remain strictly vegetarian.

Fields.MenuText: Given the luck I am having today, you might just end up catching seaweed.
You can always catch and release, you know.
The act of fishing is just as important as actually catching something.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. You may very well do so.
I suppose that's an option.
Yes, that is correct. I can see how this could be an art of its own.
Very well, I shall put my full effort into this. Pass me a rod.
Actually, I think we're going to have to set our fishing expedition aside for now. Looks like our patrols have finally reeled in a whopper.
@BATTLE
There's too many of them!
No.
Takao, what are you doing? I told you to retreat.
We can't do that. There's still a battle to be fought.
But we are being overwhelmed! At least move back to cover.
Sorry, Kanchou, but my pride as a warrior does not allow me to do that. I will fight to the very end.

Fields.MenuText: A champion also knows how to grow stronger from defeats, and that requires being alive to tell the tale.
Takao, that's an order.
You may be up for more of a fight, but we need to look after everyone here.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I'll have to think about that.
... I understand and obey. I just hope that you prove to have guts and reason behind the command.
I suppose you're right. I'll see if my healing skills can help the others recover.
It looks like we're fenced in.
Then we have no choice but to fight. Let's not make this easy for them!
That's the spirit, Kanchou! Charge!
@BATTLE
Takao, what is with all of these plants and rocks?
Oh, I was thinking of making a small garden for meditation.
On the ship?
Yes. I feel that it will be useful as a retreat for training and planning. I just need to find the perfect place.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure if a garden will mesh well with the ship's structure.
The ocean climate could prove deadly for your garden; not to mention the battles.
We cannot afford to spend too many resources on it.

Fields.DialogueText: That serene blend of aesthetics, between the natural and unnatural, is a key element of such gardens.
Everything perishes in the end. All we can do is to hold onto and cherish those oases of beauty before they fade.
Do not worry. Austerity defines a garden like the one I have in mind.
All right, you have my permission. Need any help setting it up?
That would be greatly appreciated. I focus so much on the art of war that my craftsmanship has slid. Inexcusable, I know.
That means you just have to work harder to catch back up.
You're right. I just hope we can find a garden of peace that will hold out, for at least a little while.
Yes, it is nice to rest and rejuvenate your spirit.
Even so, the world won't be able to rest soundly unless we do our jobs. Morganas approach.
@BATTLE
Takao, are you...?
Yes?
Aaaah!
Don't shout like that. You need to stay calm at all times.
Sorry, your mask just startled me.
It is a little fearsome, I will admit. Do you like it?
It's... impressive.
It's called a tengu; a winged monster said to be a master of the arts and of combat. A personal inspiration for me, if perhaps an unconventional one.

Fields.MenuText: Funny. I've never thought of monsters as being artistic.
What's with the long nose?
I wonder if they exist...

Fields.DialogueText: It's a bit of a mistranslation, really; in Japan we say Youkai, which can be good or evil all the same.
It used to be a beak; it was changed to a nose over time.
Of course they do. They are just wise and know how to hide.
You seem very fascinated with the tengu.
I am. Many a hero gained his training from them.
Kind of like how I am learning from you.
Don't flatter me too much, Kanchou. But, yes, kind of like that.
I just wish that these Morganas would have easy weaknesses, like other monsters.
@BATTLE
I guess we'll have to revise how we look at things. The world is changing.
I see. Well, if a battleship can become a woman, I guess anything's possible.
You might be right.
Takao, why are you doodling on the walls?
Oh, my apologies, Kanchou! I just had an inspiration for something.
But do you have to vandalize your own ship?
Vandalize? This is a work of art.
Look, you'll need to clean it off for the inspection later.
But I was so proud of my calligraphy...

Fields.MenuText: Can't you discipline yourself?
It is kind of majestic...
Couldn't you just copy it onto paper?

Fields.DialogueText: I can, it's just... I don't like to restrict myself from doing things I enjoy.
See? I couldn't wait for the inspiration to fade; I had to record it for posterity, one way or another.
It wouldn't be the same. Much as a vision from a mountain depends on where you gaze from it, the form of art depends on the setting it is projected onto.
I guess you don't have to erase them. Just remember to ask the next time, please?
Thank you, Kanchou. This means a lot to me.
Don't mention it. We all have things we enjoy. So this is the other kind of art you practice. It's kind of unique. What is it meant to be about?
It is based on the legends of the Heike, who died at sea and came back as sea creatures.
Well, we have plenty of that in real life, too. Everyone to their stations!
@BATTLE
Yes! Keep going, I can do this...
Takao, can we go over our plans for the operation now?
Careful, Kanchou! You just knocked over the koma!
Huh? Oh, I see. You were playing with them?
No, no -- practicing. A good soldier always trains for the next challenge.
I know that, but it's just kind of disconcerting to see you playing with tops, of all things.
First of all, it's called a koma. And second, I for one enjoy this exercise.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry. It just doesn't seem much like you.
You're right; it's good to take satisfaction in what you do.
Actually, I think the tops are pretty neat.

Fields.DialogueText: On the contrary; it reflects my own spiritual drive as a warrior. Even as chaos and chance try to topple it, the koma bravely struggles on in its fleeting dream.
Exactly. You must believe in what you practice, and put your full spirit into it.
I know, right? It's so much fun to watch them go round and round and round...
Do you think you could show me how it's done?
Of course. Then perhaps we can see who can spin longest. Watch carefully...
*BOOM*
Uh-oh. We'll have to do that later; a Morgana is here.
A soldier's work is never done. No problem; just like the koma, we will face whatever challenges hit us and continue moving forward.
@BATTLE
I never imagined that I would be discussing the philosophy of tops.
All right, Kanchou, it's time for the next stage of our training. Ready?
After getting this far, I'm ready for anything. What's next? Meditating under waterfalls? Fighting bears?
Nothing like that yet. We are going to walk.
Walk?
Well, hike is probably a better word for it. But yes. All over the ship. So let's go.
All right. I'm still a little confused, but let's go.
Pick up the pace, Kanchou! I still apply the same discipline to all forms of exercise, so don't expect to slack off.
I'm going, I'm going!
Good.

Fields.MenuText: Why hiking, though?
This is fun.
Do they do much hiking at your mountain?

Fields.DialogueText: It is a useful aerobic practice that is not as strenuous on the muscles while strengthening the heart.
I know!
Why, yes. There are plenty of trails for hiking. Perhaps we should do some climbing as well.
Whew! This is tougher than I thought.
Don't worry, we're almost a quarter of the way through already.
A quarter?! Takao, can't we take a break? Please?
Oh. Well, I suppose we can stop for now.
Thank you!
Don't thank me yet. The reason I suggested we stop is because we have more immediate concerns, like Morganas on the prowl.
Of course...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, could you help me with something, please?
Sure thing, Takao. What is it?
I am having trouble sketching out this design. I am more of an artist than an engineer, so I don't know how to make it work.
Let's see. ... It... looks like you want to pump a bunch of water and make it spill out onto the deck from above.
And from there, straight back into the sea. Can't be wasteful, after all.
Takao, why on earth would you want to make an artificial waterfall on the ship?
Why, don't you remember? You suggested it, after all.
Don't tell me...
It is called suigyo, and it helps strengthen the nerves and sharpen your concentration.

Fields.MenuText: That kind of seems over the top.
I was joking, you know.
I'm not sure that it will work with how the vessel is set up.

Fields.DialogueText: When you dedicate yourself to the path, nothing can stop you.
Oh? And I thought I had said you would need to take the training seriously.
Maybe you're right. I just kind of have a fixation with vertical alignments. I thought this would make it a little more like my home.
I'll see what I can do. But I can't make any promises.
Just as long as you give it your best shot.
In the meantime, perhaps we could do something in the ocean?
That could work. But first we'll need to clear out the resident water hazards.
@BATTLE
Never mind.
All right, Kanchou. Today, we are going to work on meditation.
Sure. That should be easy.
Oh, you think so?
I don't like that look on your face...
Meditation takes careful yet relaxed concentration to reach its full potential. I want you to sit cross-legged, in this pose, for the next two minutes.
All right. But what's with that wooden staff?
Ah, that's just a little incentive for meditating properly.
Meaning...?
If you start to break your concentration, I'll give you a light rap.
Fine. I'll start.
Some Time Later
That's it; we're done. How do you feel?

Fields.MenuText: It felt like something kept hitting me on the head.
I felt... nothing.
I imagined an endless field of green, and staring up at the blue sky.

Fields.DialogueText: That's because you kept trying to open your eyes!
Good. Go deep enough, and you can feel a void of emptiness, in which everything becomes clear.
See? Meditation like this helps your mind flourish.
Well, you're right; meditation is good for the soul. I feel alert and ready for anything.
Good; we will need a confident mind to get through this next wave.
@BATTLE
Ow! Not again...
What are you up to, Takao?
I was trying to sew some silk.
Sew? Can't say I expected that.
It's not my usual hobby, but it is a key industry in Hachioji around my mountain, so I thought I would give it a shot. I didn't think it would be so hard...
Hey, are those puncture marks all over your fingers? You don't need to hurt yourself over this.
I can take it. What I cannot accept is letting myself fail in something.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could treat this as a form of calligraphy.
Try to treat the needle carefully, like all of your other weapons.
It's fine to admit that you have areas of weakness.

Fields.DialogueText: That actually could work... Yes, this is a similar sort of art.
I'm not an inchling. But I see your point; I was rather careless.
Yes, but I don't like giving up.
I can help, if you want.
It's all right, I almost have it–
You'll have to set that aside for now; we have some Morganas to poke holes in.
@BATTLE
Mmm! What's cooking?
Seaweed salad.
Oh? You managed to fish some up?
Yes; now I am going to see about making a meal of it.
Interesting. I didn't know you were a cook.
I like have a well rounded skill set. Here, taste.
Huh, not bad.
I am glad that you like it. You should eat vegetarian more often.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, but I have an attachment to meat.
I wouldn't be against trying it.
What are the benefits of such a diet?

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. We all have different values.
Thanks. I'll be there to support you all the way.
Well, there are health benefits, but what attracts me to it the most is the sense of spiritual harmony, like I am closer to nature.
Great seaweed. I wonder if it would make a good sushi wrap.
Sushi? I know some people say fish isn't meat, but I still say it counts.
Well, you could use vegetables instead. Anyway, it was a good meal. Thank you for sharing.
You're welcome. Sometimes I wonder if all of this war is damaging the environment beneath the water's surface.
If so, that just gives us more incentive to stop the Morganas as soon as possible. And here's our next chance at that!
@BATTLE
Now then, let's see how to hook them up.
What's with all of the guns piled up?
Oh, I ordered several replacement guns for myself.
But that many?
Well, I thought my old guns were looking a little worn.
This might be a little much, though.
It's not that bad.

Fields.MenuText: Just make sure you actually put them all to good use.
I thought you preferred swords?
Make sure you know how to handle them.

Fields.DialogueText: I will. I take the responsibility very seriously.
Both have their own value. Swords have a link to a noble past, but you cannot deny the effectiveness of firepower in this day and age.
I will. You can never underestimate the dangers of weapons as you dance on the edge of life and death.
All right, you can keep them. I still find it amazing that you can get all of them to fit on you.
It is all a matter of organization. I probably should test out how each one shoots, though.
Well, you'll get your chance in a minute.
I see what you mean. Time for some target practice!
@BATTLE
Heave, ho! Heave, ho!
Takao!
Yes, Kanchou?
Drop what you're doing– not on my foot, though!
Sorry. What did you want to talk about with me?
All these rocks! Why are you hauling these huge slabs on board?
I thought they would make a nice addition to the garden. Do you think you can help me with it?

Fields.MenuText: All this heavy material could sink the ship.
Why use stones in particular?
Be considerate where you take them from. Rock doesn't regrow like plants.

Fields.DialogueText: Not to worry. I can handle the extra burden. In fact, perhaps we should move on to the next training stage – with weights.
Plants are usually the first thing you think of for gardens, but what of the earth they rest upon? That, too, is precious. And the stones also remind me of my dear mountain.
Yes, I am aware that even mountains can die if chipped away at carelessly. I gathered most of this from the ocean, and I have tried to be careful in my selection.
Since it's already on deck, you might as well try to find a place for them.
Thank you, Kanchou. I think it will give a natural aesthetic to the ship.
Well, at the very least it will give some literal sense to the metaphor "sink like a rock."
Don't worry, I'll take care of these Morganas.
First, get these rocks out of the way before they roll and crush somebody. We have enough to worry about.
@BATTLE
Oh, no...
Well, things are peaceful for the moment.
Let's hope it stays that way. We can use a respite from all the battles.
Perhaps, but we need to fight if we want to make things safe for our homelands and for the world.
You're right. Say, what do you have in mind for when the war is over?
Me? I intend to go on a pilgrimage back to Mount Takao. I can gaze at the horizon, and be content.
That reminds me – is Takao close to the sea?
If you mean me, then yes. But the mountain is inland.
Huh. In that case, how do you plan to reach the mountain?
I... don't know. I figure I have some time to figure out what I'll do...
I'm sorry I brought that up.
That's all right. I'm aware I'll ultimately face such a dilemma. Am I to be a wanderer at sea for all time, my home but a distant memory behind me?

Fields.MenuText: You won't be alone, no matter what.
Maybe you can still find a way to visit your mountain and hometown.
Even if you don't return, you still have the memories. That's worth something, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for being here with me. As long as everyone is beside me, I suppose this can be our home as well.
Yes... I should not give up. In a world with ships coming to life and tengu doubtless hiding behind the clouds, nothing is impossible for a determined warrior.
You're right, that in itself is a precious gift. With my garden and stories, perhaps the mountain can live on out here in the vast waters.
You know, I would like to see Mount Takao too.
Should we prove fortunate, I will show you it myself.
Thank you.
But what is your wish?
I'd like to say, but right now my wish is more immediate – that we don't sink.
@BATTLE
Out of curiosity, Takao, where were you built?
Me? I was constructed at the arsenal in Yokosuka. Why do you ask?
No reason. After our conversation regarding Mount Takao, I was thinking on how interesting it is that Belles really have two "homes".
The place where we were constructed, and the place after which we were named? Yes, it all is a bit confusing...
Takao? Are you all right?
Maybe that's why I can't reach Mount Takao. Because it's not mine, really. I have never even been there, and maybe I never will.

Fields.MenuText: It's still your name. That in itself helps give you meaning.
Just because you haven't been there doesn't mean you can't somehow find a way there someday.
You can have multiple homes, each with its own special place in your heart.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. No matter where I came from, I will strive to uphold the honor of the mountain.
You're right. One day, I can truly pay homage to the –my– mountain.
Good point. Takao is just as important in my past as where I originated, and vice versa.
You'll have to tell me more about Yokosuka sometime. I'd like to know more.
Of course. But why not now?
Because we have more immediate issues.
Ah, that's why. For the honor of Yokosuka and Takao!
@BATTLE
Hello, Kanchou.
Hi. I didn't expect to see you up here on the roof.
Just practicing a few kata exercises before our training later.
Up here?
Well, I get more fresh air, and I have the place all to myself.
Especially now, when we're in the middle of a rainstorm.
That helps, too.
Takao, won't you please go inside? I'm worried about you.
I can take care of myself. I won't surrender to a little bit of rain.

Fields.MenuText: Victory or defeat, your health also matters.
If you're staying out here, so am I.
You decide what qualifies as the victory. Perhaps your victory could be outwitting the rain by remaining dry indoors?

Fields.DialogueText: I do not have to worry about such things, but I appreciate your concern.
No, no. You'll catch cold. Let's go inside.
I prefer straightforward tactics, but you have a point.
So?
Very well. I will go inside. Not that it matters much, as the rest of me remains exposed.
Sorry, I forgot.
And in any case, we need to stay out here for a little longer. Both of us.
Huh? Why?
You need to strengthen your concentration and perception. Beyond the rain, I sense a coming catastrophe.
@BATTLE
Interesting...
What is it?
I was reading about Yokosuka, and I became interested in Sarushima.
What lives there? Monkeys?
No, but there is still a diverse variety of wildlife there. It would be nice to visit it some time.
You certainly enjoy nature.
It is marvelous to watch how life struggles to thrive, whether on a mountain or island, and how they can triumph against all odds. Such is the way of warriors.

Fields.MenuText: We can't anthropomorphize it too much, though.
Nature is beautiful, all right.
We need to protect those wonders.

Fields.DialogueText: A good point. But then again, when we see human things in nature, perhaps we are really seeing the nature inside of us.
I know. Such wonders always inspire me to achieve the impossible.
Yes, from all threats human and otherwise.
Hey, if we pass any small islands, feel free to check them out.
Thank you. If I choose to do so, you are welcome to come.
Great. Though we should probably clear up the waters first; plenty of unwanted, unnatural hazards around these parts.
@BATTLE
I have you now!
Not quite. On your left!
Oof! I'm not out of this yet...
Let's take a break for a little bit. You look kind of winded.
No, I can keep going...
But Kanchou... is that blood on your shoulder?!
It's just a little cut, nothing big.
You need to get it treated now, before it infects!
All right, all right!
Kanchou, please, why were you going to ignore your wound?

Fields.MenuText: I was trying to be like you.
I didn't want to make you feel bad for hurting me.
I was embarrassed that I'm not as strong as you.

Fields.DialogueText: You sweet idiot. You will never be like me, just as I can never be you, sadly. Everyone swings his or own sword differently, so take pride in yourself.
You still have much to learn. I am honest with you on where you stand as a pupil, so please be honest with me as a teacher.
Don't be. You're growing stronger with every session, but you need to be open with your weaknesses to move forward.
Sorry about that.
It's all right. Just hold still so I can wrap the bandage on properly.
All right. You're really good with this.
Thank you. I want to be able to support my allies in combat even as I fight alongside them.
That's good. Partners look out for each other. I'll try to be better about that in the future.
Just as long as you do your best. That's all I can ask.
*ALARM*
Sorry, Kanchou. I would recommend taking some rest, but we need to eliminate these Morganas first.
@BATTLE
They are back, but we're not going to let them get away this time!
@BATTLE
Well, that finishes them all off.
Good work. Time to kick back and relax.
After closing this chapter on a proper note.
What are you doing with that tea set?
I make it a habit to perform a traditional tea ceremony after each victory. Do you wish to join me?
Is this another training exercise?
If you want it to be.
All right.
Now, then. Please pay careful attention to my instructions.
Yes, sensei.
Some Time Later
Well, we're finished. What did you think?

Fields.MenuText: The tea had an interesting flavor.
It was difficult finishing it in just a couple of gulps.
It all had a serene sort of atmosphere.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I prepare the green tea myself. It's better than the alcohol most of the sailors seem to like.
All part of the ceremony. It gets easier as you learn how to time them right.
Yes. That is what I enjoy most about the ritual. Like swordfighting, meditating, and gardening, with the proper way you gain a greater understanding of yourself and the world.
Thank you for letting me be a part of the tea ceremony.
You're welcome. You did well.
Say, since you said it might be considered training, does that mean my training is done for the day?
I never said it would be the only training.
I spoke too soon...
Ugh, these Morganas are being especially persistent this time around.
We're making progress, though. You doing all right, Kanchou?
I'm hanging in there. Your training is really coming in handy for me right now.
I'm glad to see that you're learning. Still, without you to guide me, we wouldn't have made it so far.
Takao... thank you.
So, Kanchou, what are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: We're too deep in combat for straightforward tactics. Go with your instincts.
Provide covering fire and healing support for your comrades.
Rally to me and charge. Let's end this battle together.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand perfectly. Time to let my emotions run free on the battlefield, and trust in my gut.
Don't worry. They won't come to harm under my watch.
Yes. Time to demonstrate our power as a team. Come, disciple. Let me see how much you have grown.
We're almost done. Just keep at it for a little longer.
For the honor of the nation and the Emperor!
@BATTLE
Takao, we have an issue to address regarding your personal garden.
What of it? I tried to keep it relatively harmonious so as to not disturb anyone.
It's not so much the garden as some extra things that came with it.
What do you mean?
Some insects and other pests stowed away with the plants, and they have been breeding.
Oh, so that is where they came from.
You knew?
Yes. I was delighted when I first saw a few of them alighting amongst the reeds.
Takao, they're a nuisance on the ship. We need to get rid of them.
What? But they have not done anything wrong. Why should they suffer so?

Fields.MenuText: If they get loose at our ports of call, we might damage the local ecosystems.
Usually you're all for exterminating the enemy.
Do you see them as pets or something?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I wouldn't want to inadvertently injure nature. But, nevertheless, they are alive. What to do...?
There is a difference. I fight proudly and valiantly against those who mean harm to myself or others. A bug, at most, will leave a small bite. Is that worth repaying in death?
No, not pets. Rather, I cherish their wild nature, and their will to survive even here.
I guess they can stay for now. But you'll have to make sure they stay under control; especially in regard to our supplies and shore leave.
I understand. It's just... I feel happy right now.
Why?
With plants and animals active here, in ways I never could have predicted, it feels more and more like a living environment.
Like Mount Takao.
Yes. Maybe, even this far away from my home, I can furnish new life here.
Well, we'll need to protect our new ecosystem. If something goes wrong, it will sink right along with us.
@BATTLE
Then we shall keep things right. Here comes some wrong to defeat!
Good work. You passed the test.
Good. I really have learned a lot from you.
Yes... you have.
So, what's the next step?
I'm... not sure.
What do you mean?
The truth is... you have come a long way. And even in the last few sessions, I have been struggling to determine what to teach you next.
That's impossible. I'm nowhere as good as you yet.
No, but you are at a point where you no longer need a teacher. In fact, you shouldn't – you need to mature on your own.
But where does that leave us?
That's what I'm trying to figure out. In truth, you don't need me anymore. You've proven yourself skilled in battle, and I trust in your guidance. I am sorry I cannot be of more help.

Fields.MenuText: No matter what happens, we're still friends and partners in this war, right?
Your presence alone is a great help to me, Takao.

Fields.DialogueText: Right. We'll make a good team, to the end of time.
I'm... happy to hear that, sir.
Let's win the war and get there, shall we?
It's true. Doubly so in battle.
